contentrichtext.text: {{Infobox Album| <!-- Please see WP:ALBUMS about this template --> | Name = Gusto | Type = [[Album]] | Artist = [[Guttermouth]] | Cover = Guttermouth - Gusto cover.jpg | Released = August 13, 2002 | Recorded = | Genre = [[Punk rock]] | Length = ~34:57 | Label = [[Epitaph Records|Epitaph]] | Producer = | Last album = ''[[Covered with Ants]]''<br />(2001) | This album = '''''Gusto'''''<br />(2002) | Next album = ''[[Live at the House of Blues (Guttermouth album)|Live at the House of Blues]]''<br />(2003) }} {{Album ratings | rev1 = [[Allmusic]] | rev1Score = {{Rating|1.5|5}} <ref>{{Allmusic|class=album|id=r601168|first=Brian|last=OÂ´Neill}}</ref> | rev2 = | rev2Score = | noprose = yes }} '''''Gusto''''' is the eighth album by the [[Huntington Beach, California]] [[punk rock]] band [[Guttermouth]], released in 2002 by [[Epitaph Records]]. It found the band taking their style of fast, abrasive punk rock in new directions, experimenting with elements of [[pop (music)|pop]] and other styles. Their usual tongue-in-cheek humor and sarcastic lyrics remain intact, but the album's overall sound is quite different from any of their others. This was due partly to a lineup change: founding member and frequent songwriter James Nunn had left the group the previous year, leaving guitarists Scott Sheldon and Eric Davis to fill in on [[bass guitar|bass]], along with studio bassist Hedge. The album received generally poor reviews from both critics and longtime fans, and would later be regarded by the band as somewhat of a failed experiment. == Track listing == <small>All songs written by [[Guttermouth]]</small> # "Camp Fire Girl #62" # "Scholarship in Punk" # "Gusto" # "Vacation" # "Contagious" # "Pee in the Shower" # "Walk of Shame" # "My Town" # "Contribution" # "Foot-Long" # "Looking Out for #1" # "Twins" # "My Girlfriend" # "Lemon Water" == Performers == * [[Mark Adkins]] - [[Singing|Vocals]] * Scott Sheldon - [[guitar]], [[bass guitar]], [[guiro]], backing vocals * Eric "Derek" Davis - guitar, bass guitar, [[keyboard instrument|keyboards]], vocals * Hedge - bass (tracks 1, 2, 5, 6 & 11) * William Tyler "Ty" Smith - [[Drum kit|drums]] * Eric Mayron - vocals on "Lemon Water" * [[Emily Whitehurst|Emily "Agent M" Whitehurst]] ([[Tsunami Bomb]]) - backing vocals on "My Town" and "Twins" ==Album information== *Record label: [[Epitaph Records]] *Recorded at Paramount Studios and Can Am Studios *Mixed at Paramount Studios by Jim Goodwin *Mastered by Gene Grimaldi at Oasis Mastering *Produced by Scott Sheldon, Eric Davis, Jim Goodwin, and [[Mark Adkins]] *All songs by Guttermouth *Art by Mark Adkins *Layout by C. Martin ==References== <references/> {{Guttermouth}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Gusto (Album)}} [[Category:Guttermouth albums]] [[Category:2002 albums]] [[Category:Epitaph Records albums]]
